image.altText: Two people wearing masks and holding bottles of champagne with sparklers on them.

props.synopsis: The prevalence of sparklers at a Swiss ski resort bar where dozens of people died in a fire has been branded "irresponsible", as authorities probe potential compliance issues there.

title.children: 'Irresponsible': Sparklers and venue become focus of Swiss bar blaze probe

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: What are you watching in Australian politics in 2026? That's the question we put to the ABC's political journalists and columnists.

title.children: Political outlook 'dramatically shifted' after Bondi

image.altText: An overturned car and multiple fires burn outside a police station in Iran.

props.synopsis: President Donald Trump says the United States is "locked and loaded" to respond if Iran kills protesters, prompting Tehran to warn that intervention would destabilise the region.

title.children: Trump says US will 'come to their rescue' if Iran kills protesters

image.altText: A close up of a woman holding a photograph of three young women

props.synopsis: An Australian woman is believed to have become the first person in the world to donate organs after self-administering oral voluntary assisted dying medication.

title.children: World-first organ donation as mum self-administers VAD medication

image.altText: Xi Jinping

props.synopsis: The US has no intention of abandoning Taiwan. But it also has no intention of binding itself to an automatic war commitment on a timeline it does not control.

title.children: Two truths and a lie: inside the China-Taiwan-US triangle

image.altText: An illustration showing smog from Chinese factories juxtaposed with a bushfire in Australia.

props.synopsis: As China caps off a historic clean-up of its smog and air pollution, the clearer air is helping temperatures rise to new records. Now, researchers are linking that change to hotter and drier conditions in Australia.

title.children: China's anti-pollution crusade linked to Australian bushfires

image.altText: An extreme close up of Donald Trump with his eyes closed and a grimacing expression

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says he regrets undergoing advanced imagery on his heart and abdomen because of the "ammunition" it handed his critics, but has once more defended his "perfect" health.

title.children: What we learned from Donald Trump's wide-ranging health interview

image.altText: A man with short hair looks neutrally at another man who's facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: Ukraine's president has named Kyrylo Budanov, a legendary intelligence leader in the country, as the new head of his presidential office.

title.children: Volodymyr Zelenskyy names spy chief as new top aide

image.altText: Clara Pribadi holds a stack of books outside a store

props.synopsis: While some people might find goal setting motivating — such as reading X number of books each year or pages each day — there is a risk of turning what is supposed to be a pleasurable activity into a chore.

title.children: Are reading goals helpful or performative? How to read more in the new year

image.altText: Australia cricketer Usman Khawaja touches his face with his finger during his retirement press conference.

props.synopsis: Australia batter Usman Khawaja takes aim at his critics one last time as he announces his retirement from international cricket.

title.children: Khawaja hits out at 'racial stereotypes' as he announces Test retirement

image.altText: Australian Test batter Usman Khawaja looks to the sky as he walks off after losing his wicket.

props.synopsis: Before his debut in 2011, Australia had never seen a cricketer like Usman Khawaja and, thanks to his work on and off the field, he'll be followed by plenty more.

title.children: Khawaja's on-field brilliance pales in comparison to his true impact

image.altText: A man, woman and teenage girl stand for a photo with lines of other people behind them

props.synopsis: The North Korean leader's daughter, reportedly named Kim Ju Ae, has been making increasingly prominent appearances in state media, fuelling speculation she may be in line to be the country's fourth-generation leader.

title.children: Kim Jong Un's daughter visits state mausoleum, fueling heir speculation

image.altText: Waves crashing on rocks at Coogee Beach.

props.synopsis: The identity of one of four people who died in a cluster of drownings on the New South Wales coast in recent days has been confirmed as a Sydney hairdresser and mother.

title.children: 'Everybody knows her': Sydney mother one of four drowning victims

image.altText: A sign for the mine at its entrance

props.synopsis: One man is in hospital and another is missing following an incident at a Central Queensland coal mine.

title.children: Rescue operations underway after coal mine collapse

image.altText: Steve Waugh brings up his century on the last ball of day two of the fifth Ashes Test in 2003

props.synopsis: With one ball remaining on day two of the fifth Ashes Test in 2003, Steve Waugh stared down a century and his own cricketing mortality before securing one of the most famous centuries of his storied career.

title.children: Two decades on, Waugh's last-ball century completes his perfect day

image.altText: A splitscreen graphic showing 50 in orange against a blue background beside another 50 in blue against an orange background

props.synopsis: Every question has only two options: one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

title.children: ABC 50/50 quiz: This week we're testing your knowledge of Kylie Minogue, Greek gods and card games

image.altText: Woman with dark glasses and pashmina looks at camera, with coloured porcelain pieces in the background

props.synopsis: The first retrospective of the ceramic artist's work has gone on show in Perth at the state gallery, telling the story of an extraordinary career.

title.children: The unstoppable creativity of ceramicist Pippin Drysdale

image.altText: Four Easter Island Moai silhouettes in single file line on a platform in front of an orange setting sun and glowing clouds.

props.synopsis: A study using 11,600 aerial drone photos to map a mountainous quarry in 3D reveals more about how the island's famed stone sentinels were created and moved to their final resting places.

title.children: Easter Island researchers say giant statues 'walked' into position

image.altText: Jabiru sign

props.synopsis: The remote Northern Territory town of Jabiru has faced rolling blackouts since New Year's Eve, with no clear indication of when power will be properly restored.

title.children: Remote NT town in power limbo amid rolling blackouts since New Years Eve

image.altText: Xi Jinping in a navy suit and red tie clapping his hands and smiling slightly

props.synopsis: Beijing's new measures are aimed at trying to rein in an Australian surge and manage local growth, rather than a direct target on Australia.

title.children: China's beef tariffs aren't about Australia

image.altText: Aerial view of protesters marching down a major road in downtown Tehran.

props.synopsis: Protests spread from the capital Tehran to other cities and across demographics, with people demanding Iran's leaders end the country's clerical rule and hold free elections.

title.children: 'A hunger revolution': Inside the massive protests sweeping Iran

image.altText: A man in a Brisbane Lions guernsey kicking a football

props.synopsis: The club said the 32-year-old had made the decision following a "challenging personal period".

title.children: Lachie Neale apologises for actions that led to marriage breakdown

image.altText: Landscape showing Federation Peak

props.synopsis: Three bushwalkers are rescued from near Federation Peak in Tasmania's remote south-west after one of them fell 5 metres, sustaining a non-life-threatening head injury.

title.children: Walkers rescued after one fell 5m near Tasmania's Federation Peak

image.altText: Lightning strikes

props.synopsis: Queensland's Darling Downs has recorded more severe storm warning days than any other region this season — and meteorologists say it is no coincidence.

title.children: Why severe storms keep forming over Queensland's Darling Downs

image.altText: A menorah stands amount candles, flowers and an Australian flag at a memorial to the victims of the Bondi terror attack.

props.synopsis: Former Reserve Bank governors and CEOs are among more than 130 business leaders and prominent Australians calling for a Commonwealth royal commission in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack.

title.children: Nation's biggest employer groups now support royal commission into Bondi attack

image.altText: Bernie Sanders, Rama Duwaji and Zohran Mamdani stand on a stage in front of City Hall.

props.synopsis: New York's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, has vowed not to water down his ambitious agenda during an impassioned inauguration address outside City Hall. But is his vision achievable?

title.children: Bernie Sanders swears in Zohran Mamdani with a word of warning

image.altText: Close-up of wallaby joey in a fabric pouch

props.synopsis: Wildlife carers have lodged formal complaints with police and environment officials after stumbling across a scene involving a dead mother wallaby tied to a signpost.

title.children: Wallaby joey euthanased after 'horrific' animal cruelty discovery

image.altText: A seal with its mouth open.

props.synopsis: As we start the new year, take some time out to explore some of the other stories you might have missed this holiday period.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Ravenous ladybirds, a grumpy seal and a unique home

image.altText: Graffitied roller doors on Victoria Street.

props.synopsis: Richmond's Victoria Street, once a buzzing area home to dozens of restaurants and grocers, has seen better days. What can be done to bring it back to its bustling best?

title.children: This Melbourne suburb has been on the decline, but a new future beckons

image.altText: Houses are seen in the suburb of Kelvin Grove in Brisbane

props.synopsis: Brisbane's housing market remains one of the strongest in the nation, with prices up 1.6 per cent in December even as Sydney and Melbourne see some growth moderation in property valuations.

title.children: Brisbane beats Sydney and Melbourne in price growth

image.altText: Todd Murphy of Australia bowls in the nets

props.synopsis: Todd Murphy could play his first Test match on Australian soil as the curator of the SCG allays fears over the pitch.

title.children: Murphy in line for comeback as SCG curator defends green pitch exterior

image.altText: A woman with short dark hair and glasses in a floral top.

props.synopsis: The Clark MP says she knows the decision "will be disappointing for some," but it is necessary for her to be "effective" in parliament — a move that has "blindsided" her former colleagues.

title.children: Greens member 'blindsides' Tasmanian party by quitting

image.altText: A man and a woman on a farm look solemnly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Two heritage homes and thousands of hectares of land were lost in a Christmas Day bushfire in Boddington.

title.children: Family watches Boddington heritage property burn in Christmas Day fire

image.altText: runway feeling off in huge chunks revealing dirt underneath as three men observe

props.synopsis: Rain has hit saturation point in parts of northern Queensland as communities remain isolated and cattle are lost.

title.children: Roads, rail, runways impacted as outback flooding continues

image.altText: Damaged red SUV on grass, bricks on the ground

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old man has been remanded in custody after allegedly going on a multi-day crime spree across Victoria's south-east involving carjackings, burglaries and a police pursuit.

title.children: Man accused of wild rampage across Latrobe Valley appears in court
